SELECT
    s.unit_id,
    MIN(all_days.day) AS min_date,
    MAX(all_days.day) AS max_date
FROM
    -- Gera todos os dias do período dinâmico
    (SELECT generate_series(
        CASE
            WHEN EXTRACT(DAY FROM CURRENT_DATE) = 1 THEN DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 month')::date -- Se for dia 1, pega o mês passado
            ELSE DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE)::date                                                             -- Se não, pega o mês atual
        END,
        (CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 day')::date, -- Sempre até o dia anterior ao dia atual
        '1 day'
    ) AS day) AS all_days
CROSS JOIN
    -- Seleciona todas as lojas que tiveram vendas no período relevante
    (SELECT DISTINCT unit_id
     FROM sales
     WHERE date >= CASE
                        WHEN EXTRACT(DAY FROM CURRENT_DATE) = 1 THEN DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 month')
                        ELSE DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE)
                    END
       AND date < CURRENT_DATE) AS s -- Aliás 's' para ser usado no SELECT principal e ON clause
LEFT JOIN
    -- Seleciona as vendas reais no mesmo período
    (SELECT DISTINCT date::date AS sale_date, unit_id
     FROM sales
     WHERE date >= CASE
                        WHEN EXTRACT(DAY FROM CURRENT_DATE) = 1 THEN DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 month')
                        ELSE DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE)
                    END
       AND date < CURRENT_DATE) AS actual_sales
ON
    all_days.day = actual_sales.sale_date
    AND s.unit_id = actual_sales.unit_id
WHERE
    actual_sales.sale_date IS NULL -- Identifica os dias sem vendas
GROUP BY
    s.unit_id
ORDER BY
    s.unit_id;
